text: Tune in to wisdom from CCE Mentors

recordings.title: Seeking first to understand then be understood
recordings.question: How to deal with the discrepancies between boss's evaluation and self evaluation? How to respond manager's feedback?

recordings.title: Retirement Financial Planning
recordings.question: Q1: How should I plan and prepare for my financial needs after retirement from work? Q2: My career plan is to continue my current stable job and retire within 5-10 years. But my family feels that our pension planning and savings are not enough, and they want me to accept newer challenges. Do I need to change to a job with better pay?

recordings.title: How to respond to the boss's emotions
recordings.question: The leader at work is emotionally unstable and often handles problems by swearing and getting angry (without directly telling her what she thinks). Although sometimes I know what she thinks, in this state, I don't want to I can satisfy her requests in this way at any time, because it consumes a lot of my strength to deal with her emotions every time. What should I do? Can I pursue other job opportunities?

recordings.title: How to lead a team
recordings.question: Q1: I have no management responsibilities, should I be concerned about this issue? Q2: As a (junior, middle, senior) manager of a company/unit, how should I lead my team? Q3: As the person in charge of the company, how should I lead the team?

recordings.title: Achieving set goals
recordings.question: Q1: I often fail to achieve the goals set by my boss or myself. Why? What should I do?

recordings.title: Which path should I continue to develop? A new major? Or the original major?
recordings.question: Q1: My undergraduate and first master's degrees were in design, and I worked for a while after graduation. Later, my family felt that the IT major was developing well and had many job opportunities, so they suggested that I study for a second master's degree in computer science. Although I graduated successfully, I don't like programming very much. When I was applying for a job, I found that employment was not as good as I imagined. Now I am very confused and hesitate to go all out to find a design-related position?

recordings.title: How to handle conflicts with colleagues
recordings.question: Q1: My colleague is very articulate, likes to steal the limelight, and even likes to take credit for everything I do. My boss can’t do anything to him and asks me to be patient. What should I do? Q2: I will compromise in the moment because I am afraid that my colleagues will be angry, but I will feel useless afterwards. What should I do? Q3: I will make a habit of choosing a plan that is more acceptable to my colleagues to avoid conflicts. Is this right? What should I do?

recordings.title: How to prepare for and make career adjustments
recordings.question: Q1: I currently work as an accountant, but I am more talented and interested in beauty and cosmetics. How should I prepare myself and make career adjustments? Q2: I am currently working as a frontline staff member and am only responsible for my own professional projects, but I am interested in taking up a management position. How should I prepare myself and make career adjustments?

recordings.title: As the head of a department, what should I do?
recordings.question: Q1: I am the head of the company's human resources department. One of the company's indicators was not achieved and was attributed to the human resources department. I analyzed the reasons and proposed a solution. To solve the problem, we must reform. The company asked me to produce a data analysis report. I made a complete analysis report, but it was never approved and the problem was never solved. Since I can't solve these problems, the company's senior management has been putting pressure on me. What should I do?

recordings.title: How to build a relationship with my boss?
recordings.question: Q1: I have recently been transferred from an engineer to a project leader, and I am still learning the new role. The new boss has a marketing background, and I cannot feel comfortable communicating with her. How can I build a relationship with my boss?

recordings.title: What should I do if I am wronged at work?
recordings.question: Q1: My colleague's one-sided statement made my boss think it was my fault, what should I do?

recordings.title: Interaction with colleagues at work
recordings.question: Q1: How to help my colleague who holds a negative view on others' intent?

recordings.title: Seeking Guidance II
recordings.question: Q1: If I have received God's promise, but they have not been fulfilled, how should we continue to pray or respond? Q2: How Christians can preach the gospel in the workplace?

recordings.title: Seeking Guidance I
recordings.question: Q1: How to seek God’s will in the workplace ? Q2: How can I confirm that what I am doing is from God’s will?

recordings.title: Submit to a boss who is not easy to obey
recordings.question:
The Bible teaches that you must obey your boss, both gentle and perverse.
Q1: What are the reasons that prevent you from obeying your boss? Q2: How to overcome these obstacles? Q3: If my boss often asks me to do things that are within the scope of his responsibilities, I feel a little unfair and I also feel that my boss has not shouldered the responsibilities he should bear. How to respond? Do you want to obey blindly?

recordings.title: Managing disobedient subordinates
recordings.question: Q1: How to manage subordinates who are disobedient and do not follow instructions? Q2: I have reported to my supervisor that I would like to remove the disobedient subordinate from his current position. Is this correct?

recordings.title: Colleagues who sow discord
recordings.question: Q1: What should you do if you encounter a colleague who likes to gossip ? It has caused discord between the team?

recordings.title: I Fly Young CCE Focus Group Interview I
recordings.question: Q1: How do you learn about the I Fly Young CCE Focus Goup? Q2: What's the biggest impact to you as result of attending the CCE focus group? Q3: Who might benefit the most from attending the CCE focus group? (aka who would you recommend to sign up for CCE focus group) Q4: What are the talents you see in the mentee? Q5: How do you recommend the mentee to keep investing in himself/herself?

recordings.title: How to have positive impact in the workplace
recordings.question: Amid economic turmoil and the pandemic, how can we have a positive impact in the workplace?

recordings.title: Asking right questions
recordings.question: Seeking guidance at work (changing jobs? careers? or attitudes?)
